CatDescriptText: Joan Ptaszkiewicz, cashier, 2514 Josephine Street, Southside, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "Yes, I do and the reason is because other people do not like to paddle and otherwise discipline the children like some mothers do when this is needed."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joan Ptaszkiewicz wearing light colored plush coat, wristwatch, and ring, holding dark handbag and paper bag in right hand, and holding collar closed with left hand, standing on sidewalk with telephone pole with sign that reads "...Tow Zone 10 min..."
